page.title: 12Housing - By Mrs Jeffery
page.content: Housing is concentrated around Cheriton Bishop village. There are many old cob houses,most now have tile roofs not thatch. The oldest is 15th- century 'Church Cottage'. Glebelands, Woodpecker Way and Hescane Park are modern developments. Glebelands has 40 mixed bungalows and houses built between the mid-1950's and 1975 for both council and private ownership. 12 bungalows are sheltered housing for elderly people supervised by a warden. Woodpecker Way has 10 bungalows mostly owned by retired people. Hescane Park has 7 detached and semi-detached houses under construction with plans for 21 more. The houses have 3/4 bedrooms and cost between Â£33,250 and Â£60,000. The council owned about 18 houses in the village but some have been bought by their occupants.
